what: Extract and Query Data from the National Flood Hazard Layers
title: Extract and Query Data from the National Flood Hazard Layers
text: NFHL package provides access data FEMA’s National Flood Hazards Layers. integates AOI package spatial subsetting workflows offers functionality extract query NFHL layers.

title: Extract and Query Data from the National Flood Hazard Layers
text: can install development version NFHL GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") remotes::install_github("mikejohnson51/NFHL")  # load libraries  library(NFHL) library(AOI) library(dplyr)

title: Extract and Query Data from the National Flood Hazard Layers
text: NFHL contains data 32 layers. Use nfhl_meta view list available layer IDs names.
code: nfhl_meta #>                                type layerID #> 1                 NFHL Availability       0 #> 2                             LOMRs       1 #> 3                             LOMAs       2 #> 4                       FIRM Panels       3 #> 5                        Base Index       4 #> 6                              PLSS       5 #> 7  Topographic Low Confidence Areas       6 #> 8                River Mile Markers       7 #> 9           Datum Conversion Points       8 #> 10                    Coastal Gages       9 #> 11                            Gages      10 #> 12                            Nodes      11 #> 13                 High Water Marks      12 #> 14             Station Start Points      13 #> 15                   Cross-Sections      14 #> 16                Coastal Transects      15 #> 17            Base Flood Elevations      16 #> 18                Profile Baselines      17 #> 19               Transect Baselines      18 #> 20    Limit of Moderate Wave Action      19 #> 21                      Water Lines      20 #> 22          Political Jurisdictions      22 #> 23                           Levees      23 #> 24               General Structures      24 #> 25            Primary Frontal Dunes      25 #> 26               Hydrologic Reaches      26 #> 27          Flood Hazard Boundaries      27 #> 28               Flood Hazard Zones      28 #> 29            Submittal Information      29 #> 30                    Alluvial Fans      30 #> 31                        Subbasins      31 #> 32                      Water Areas      32

title: Extract and Query Data from the National Flood Hazard Layers
text: get detailed information, layer name, description, bounding box, use nfhl_describe() function. example, let’s explore Layer ID 14 (Cross-Sections):
code: nfhl_describe(14) #> $Layer #> [1] "Cross-Sections (ID: 14)" #>  #> $Description #> [1] "Normally, any FIRM that has associated flood profiles has cross sections. The S_XS table contains information about cross section lines. These lines usually represent the locations of channel surveys performed for input into the hydraulic model used to calculate flood elevations. Sometimes cross sections are interpolated between surveyed cross sections using high accuracy elevation data. Depending on the zone designation (Zone AE, Zone A, etc.), these locations may be shown on Flood Profiles in the FIS report and can be used to cross reference the Flood Profiles to the planimetric depiction of the flood hazards. This information is used in the Floodway Data Tables in the FIS report, as well as on the FIRM panels." #>  #> $bbox #> Geometry set for 1 feature  #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -170.8102 ymin: -14.3509 xmax: 145.7601 ymax: 64.89804 #> Geodetic CRS:  NAD83 #> POLYGON ((-170.8102 -14.3509, 145.7601 -14.3509...

title: Extract and Query Data from the National Flood Hazard Layers
text: nfhl_get() function retrieves spatial data specific layer area interest (AOI). general workflow involves: Defining AOI. Selecting layer ID. Extracting spatial data.
code: # Define an AOI around UCSB AOI <- AOI::aoi_ext("UCSB", wh = 10, units = "km", bbox = TRUE) |>     st_as_sf()  # View at Layer ID 28 description nfhl_describe(28)$Description #> [1] "The S_Fld_Haz_Ar table contains information about the flood hazards within the flood risk project area. These zones are used by FEMA to designate the SFHA and for insurance rating purposes.  These data are the regulatory flood zones designated by FEMA."  # Extract Flood Hazard Polygons and filter by Special Flood # Hazard Areas (SFHA) floodhazard <- nfhl_get(AOI, 28) %>%     filter(SFHA_TF == "T")

title: Extract and Query Data from the National Flood Hazard Layers
text: Layer ID 14 provides cross-sectional data. Let’s overlay hydrographic data National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) using nhdplusTools package: learned NFHL offered cross-sectional information (ID: 14). Lets get data UCSB AOI, overlay hydrographic data NHD.
code: # Get NHD data for the AOI nhd <- nhdplusTools::get_nhdplus(AOI)  # Extract NFHL Cross-Section data (ID: 14) cs <- nfhl_get(nhd, 14)

title: Extract and Query Data from the National Flood Hazard Layers
text: Layer ID 24 provides data “General Structures.” , extract layer, overlay NHD data, identify structures cross NHD features. , identified 49 structural crossing’s AOI river networ. example, bridge 932599 crosses COMID 17596113.  , identified 49 structural crossing’s AOI river networ. example, bridge 932599 crosses COMID 17596113.
code: # Describe Layer ID 24 nfhl_describe(24)$Description #> [1] "This table includes levees, floodwalls, or dikes that have been designed for flood control, including those portions that are closure structures, whether or not they have been demonstrated to meet the NFIP requirements in 44 CFR 65.10. This information is shown in the Levees table in the FIS report and on the FIRM panels. The S_Levee table contains information about levees shown on the FIRMs that are accredited and known to be protecting against the 1-percent-annual-chance flood, as well as levees that are provisionally accredited, de-accredited, and never accredited. The purpose of this table is to document the accreditation status of levees, as well as associated information necessary to be shown on the FIRM and for the population of FIS report text related to levee structures. The spatial entities representing levees are lines, drawn at the centerline of levees, floodwalls, and levee closure structures."  # Extract General Structures stru <- nfhl_get(AOI, 24)  # Identify crossings between structures and NHD data crossings = st_join(stru, st_transform(nhd, st_crs(stru)), join = st_crosses,     left = FALSE) %>%     st_drop_geometry() %>%     mutate(realtionship = "crosses") %>%     select(OBJECTID, realtionship, comid, STRUCT_TYP, LAYER) #> although coordinates are longitude/latitude, st_crosses assumes that they are #> planar  # View results head(crossings) #>    OBJECTID realtionship    comid STRUCT_TYP LAYER #> 2    932599      crosses 17596113     Bridge    24 #> 3    932622      crosses 17596113     Bridge    24 #> 4    932768      crosses 17595367     Bridge    24 #> 10   932871      crosses 17595405     Bridge    24 #> 12   932842      crosses 17595351 Footbridge    24 #> 17   932527      crosses 17595357    Culvert    24

title: Extract and Query Data from the National Flood Hazard Layers
text: Mike Johnson Geospatial Science Technology Lead NOAA’s Office Water Prediction (OWP). work contributes NSFfunded Convergence Accelorator Program Urban Flooding. package experimental comes guarantee. Pull requests welcome!!

what: Query Metadata of NFHL Layer by ID — nfhl_describe
title: Query Metadata of NFHL Layer by ID — nfhl_describe
text: Retrieves metadata specific layer National Flood Hazard Layers (NFHL).

title: Query Metadata of NFHL Layer by ID — nfhl_describe
Query Metadata of NFHL Layer by ID — nfhl_describe
text: layer Integer. NFHL layer ID query. Default 28.

title: Query Metadata of NFHL Layer by ID — nfhl_describe
text: list containing: Layer: name queried layer. Description: brief description layer. bbox: bounding box layer's extent sf object.

title: Query Metadata of NFHL Layer by ID — nfhl_describe
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ metadata <- nfhl_describe(layer = 28) print(metadata$Layer) print(metadata$Description) plot(metadata$bbox) } # }

what: Query the National Flood Hazard Layers (NFHL) — nfhl_get
title: Query the National Flood Hazard Layers (NFHL) — nfhl_get
text: Subset specific NFHL layer within defined bounding box (AOI).

title: Query the National Flood Hazard Layers (NFHL) — nfhl_get
Query the National Flood Hazard Layers (NFHL) — nfhl_get
text: AOI `sf` object representing spatial area interest (must valid CRS). layer Integer. NFHL layer ID query. Default 28.

title: Query the National Flood Hazard Layers (NFHL) — nfhl_get
text: `sf` object containing NFHL subset `NULL` query fails.

title: Query the National Flood Hazard Layers (NFHL) — nfhl_get
text: function queries National Flood Hazard Layers (NFHL) web service retrieve specific layer, clipped given area interest (AOI). result transformed match CRS AOI.

title: Query the National Flood Hazard Layers (NFHL) — nfhl_get
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(sf) # Define an AOI AOI <- st_as_sf(data.frame(x = -105, y = 40), coords = c("x", "y"), crs = 4326) |>         st_buffer(0.01)  # Query NFHL layer 28 nfhl_data <- nfhl_get(AOI, layer = 28)  # Inspect result print(nfhl_data) } # }

what: National Flood Hazard Layer Metadata — nfhl_meta
title: National Flood Hazard Layer Metadata — nfhl_meta
text: data.frame specifying Layer ID date type.

title: National Flood Hazard Layer Metadata — nfhl_meta
National Flood Hazard Layer Metadata — nfhl_meta
text: object class data.frame 32 rows 2 columns.

what: National Flood Hazard Layer Endpoint — nhfl_end_point
title: National Flood Hazard Layer Endpoint — nhfl_end_point
text: character string specifying base URL NFHL web service.

title: National Flood Hazard Layer Endpoint — nhfl_end_point
National Flood Hazard Layer Endpoint — nhfl_end_point
text: object class character length 1.
